/* READ ME

 \ \ \ \/_>   <_ \ \ \   \/_\__ \  \ \ \\ \  __ \ \ \__\ \ \ ,__/\ \  _\L\ \ ,  /   
  \ \ \_ /\_, ,_\ \_\ \    /\ \L\ \ \ \ \\ \ \/\ \ \ \_/\ \ \ \/  \ \ \L\ \ \ \\ \  
   \ \___\/_/\_\/ /\___\   \ `\____\ \ \_\\ \_\ \_\ \_\\ \_\ \_\   \ \____/\ \_\ \_\
    \/___/  \/_/  \/___/    \/_____/  \/_/ \/_/\/_/\/_/ \/_/\/_/    \/___/  \/_/\/ / 

   An Artbord-Oriented Programming Enviroment for the p5.js Library.
   
   In Stamper, your code is structured into "Stamps", there are 5 types:
   
   1. Function for Setup(), Draw(), keyPressed(), yourFavFunc(), etc.
   
   2. Anything for everything else: Global Variables, Comments (like this one), Classes, etc.
   
   3. Console for printing messages
      
   4. HTML for updating the webpage which holds your sketch
   
   5. CSS for updating global style of that webpage
*/

stamps.name: //This is an "A...
dotPattern
sizeDot
basicDot
stamps.code:
noStroke()
background(255, 10)
fill(117,250,151)
ellipse(x, y, dotSize, dotSize)

/*

  Duplicate a Stamp to try a new idea
  
  1. Click on Stamp titlebar
  2. Hold Option (⌥) and drag to new position
  3. Release Mouse

*/
